document.heading: District of Columbia Public School Firearm Prohibition Temporary Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-1, the “District of Columbia Public School Firearm Prohibition Temporary Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-130. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 14, 1989, and February 28, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 21, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-8 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 8-1 became effective on May 16, 1989.
